intro: Jacea communis, commonly known as the common jacea, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Jacea communis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
